body_html: @yuhaozhang To accomplish two dimensional padding, you need an input tensor with 4 axes and similarly for three dimensional padding, you need an input tensor with 6 axes. That is my interpretation of the source code, I may be mistaken.

body: @yuhaozhang To accomplish two dimensional padding, you need an input tensor with 4 axes and similarly for three dimensional padding, you need an input tensor with 6 axes. That is my interpretation of the source code, I may be mistaken.
